User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:8.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0.1
Build ID: 20111120135848

Steps to reproduce:

1. Set a color scheme in windows's settings that dictated white text on a black background with green window titles
2. Set Firefox's colors to black on white, and unchecked "Us System Colors".
3. Went to a page with forms.


Actual results:

Pages were rendered with incorrect colors, using the system colors, instead of the black on white as prescribed in the settings. Some pages, such as the gmail login page, became unusable (white text on white), others difficult to read.


Expected results:

The pages should have been rendered with black text on white, as per the settings.
NOTE: This is only a useability problem on pages that only set ONE of the color attributes of form elements, and not the other. Otherwise it is a settings-not-working issue.
